Sentence: Frustrated, Candide sails off to France with a specially chosen companion, an unrepentantly pessimistic scholar named Martin
Candide takes this as proof that there is justice in the world, but Martin staunchly disagrees
In Paris, Candide and Martin mingle with the social elite
Candide's fortune attracts a number of hangers-on, several of whom succeed in filching jewels from him (Martin)
Martin, Cacambo, and Candide depart for Turkey, where Candide purchases Cacambo's freedom
